translated: The Chapter on the Investigation of Phenomena, the Section on the Triads

original: 7.21. Ajjhattārammaṇattika🔽Naajjhattārammaṇaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naajjhattārammaṇo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Naajjhattārammaṇaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nabahiddhārammaṇo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: na ajjhatta ārammaṇam dhammam paṭicca na ajjhatta ārammaṇaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā na ajjhatta ārammaṇam dhammam paṭicca na bahiddha ārammaṇaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: The Triad on Internal Objects🔽With an internal object as condition, an internal object arises, a dhammic condition being present. With an internal object as condition, an external object arises, a dhammic condition being present.

original: Nabahiddhārammaṇaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nabahiddhārammaṇo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Nabahiddhārammaṇaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naajjhattārammaṇo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na bahiddhā ārammaṇam dhammam paṭicca na bahiddhā ārammaṇaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā na bahiddhā ārammaṇam dhammam paṭicca na ajjhatta ārammaṇaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta
translated: With an external object as condition, an external object arises, a dhammic condition being present. With an external object as condition, an internal object arises, a dhammic condition being present. (Abbreviated.)
In the case of cause, there are nine … in the case of non-obstruction, there are nine.
